title: Do the Bruins have a potential breakout prospect in camp in Dans Locmelis?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Dans Locmelis is a promising prospect for the Bruins after a strong performance in the 2025 IIHF World Championships.
Locmelis scored 33 points in 40 games with UMass and excelled with the Providence Bruins in the AHL playoffs.
Providence head coach Ryan Mougenel praises Locmelis' adaptability and courage, highlighting his potential in the Bruins' system.

title: Rob Gronkowski: Patriots QB Drake Maye looked ‘timid’ against Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rob Gronkowski criticized Patriots QB Drake Maye's performance as 'timid' following a 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Maye started strongly, throwing a touchdown, but struggled in the second half, including an interception and multiple punts.
Patriots' special teams and defense also underperformed, allowing nine plays over 20 yards to Raiders QB Geno Smith.

title: Braintree man dies weeks after being struck by e-bike in Copley Square
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Minh Dang, 64, from Braintree, succumbed to injuries from an e-bike accident in Copley Square on August 6.
The e-bike incident occurred near Huntington Avenue and Dartmouth Street, in front of the Boston Public Library.
The bike operator stayed at the scene and faces no charges as the investigation continues.

title: Watch out for the ‘wicked high’ king tides this week at Boston Harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Boston Harbor will experience king tides, caused by the moon's orbit and phases, noticeable this fall.
King tides can raise ocean levels by two to four feet, occurring during perigee and full or new moon phases.
The Stone Living Lab will host high tide events at Long Wharf starting September 11, showcasing the phenomenon.

title: Stefon Diggs says Drake Maye isn’t a ‘softie’ when it comes to criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs praised Patriots QB Drake Maye's toughness and ability to handle criticism in a press conference.
Drake Maye faced criticism after a second-half decline in a 20-13 loss to Las Vegas at Gillette Stadium.
Stefon Diggs made his Patriots debut with six catches for 57 yards, expressing gratitude after recovering from ACL injury.

title: Audit: K-12 school department failed to investigate 22 child abuse reports
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A state audit revealed DESE failed to investigate 22 supported child abuse reports over a 41-month period.
The audit criticized DESE for delays in resolving special education complaints, averaging a 111-day delay for 28% of cases.
DESE did not fulfill responsibilities for LGBTQ students, lacking required training and materials distribution, the audit found.

title: ‘Nothing short of horrific’: Mass. politicians react to fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Charlie Kirk, 31, was fatally shot during a political event at Utah Valley University.
Massachusetts politicians, including Gov. Maura Healey and Sen. Elizabeth Warren, condemned the political violence.
Authorities questioned and released a suspect; they believe only one person was involved in the shooting.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez not practicing, along with 2 key vets
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Christian Gonzalez remains sidelined since July 28 due to a persistent hamstring injury, missing Patriots practice.
Harold Landry and Morgan Moses also missed Patriots practice, both dealing with foot injuries.
Wide receiver Kayshon Boutte was limited in practice with a shoulder injury, following a strong game against the Raiders.

title: Drake Maye talks starting fast, capitalizing in the red zone, and the throws he wished he had back
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Drake Maye acknowledged rushed throws and missed opportunities in the Patriots' season-opener loss to the Raiders.
The Patriots struggled with red zone efficiency, finishing 1-for-3, while the Raiders converted their sole opportunity.
Maye emphasized the team's need to start faster and capitalize in the red zone for future games.

title: What Celtics star Jaylen Brown said about potentially playing for hometown team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jaylen Brown, under contract with Celtics for four more years, hints at interest in playing for Atlanta Hawks one day.
Brown, from Marietta, Georgia, responded to radio host about the possibility of joining hometown team: 'You never know.'
Given Tatum's injury, Brown is expected to lead a retooled Celtics team after offseason departures of several key players.
